block.p: Allison Ann Lautenbach, a daughter of Cynthia and Ned C. Lautenbach of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Christopher Thomas Reiling, the son of Mary Reiling of Wilton, Conn., and the late Glenn Reiling. The Rev. Charles Allen performed the ceremony at St. Ann's Roman Catholic Church in Naples, Fla.

Mrs. Reiling, 24, is a university recruiter in Cambridge, Mass., for the Lotus Development Corporation, a software division of I.B.M. She graduated from Providence College. Her father, who retired as the senior vice president for worldwide sales and distribution at I.B.M., is a partner in Clayton, Dubilier & Rice, an investment company in New York. He is also the chairman of the Acterna Corporation, which makes hardware and software for testing telecommunications equipment in Burlington, Mass.

Allison Ann Lautenbach, a daughter of Cynthia and Ned C. Lautenbach of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Christopher Thomas Reiling, the son of Mary Reiling of Wilton, Conn., and the late Glenn Reiling. The Rev. Charles Allen performed the ceremony at St. Ann's Roman Catholic Church in Naples, Fla.

Mrs. Reiling, 24, is a university recruiter in Cambridge, Mass., for the Lotus Development Corporation, a software division of I.B.M. She graduated from Providence College. Her father, who retired as the senior vice president for worldwide sales and distribution at I.B.M., is a partner in Clayton, Dubilier & Rice, an investment company in New York. He is also the chairman of the Acterna Corporation, which makes hardware and software for testing telecommunications equipment in Burlington, Mass.

Mr. Reiling, 25, works in Waltham, Mass., as an e-business software specialist for I.B.M. He graduated from the University of Connecticut at Storrs. His mother is a business operations manager in I.B.M.'s offices in Somers, N.Y., where his father was a business analyst.
